meanings.definition: Making or constituting a disturbingly harsh and loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The raucous thunderstorm kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The raucous concert caused my ears to ring for hours.
meanings.sent3: The raucous alarm clock startled me awake every morning.
meanings.sent4: The raucous traffic outside sounded like a never-ending symphony of car horns.
meanings.sent5: The raucous laughter of the children playing in the park echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The raucous party next door kept me up until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: The raucous group of fans cheered loudly at the football game.
meanings.sent3: The raucous behavior of the students in the cafeteria made the teachers frown.
meanings.sent4: The raucous crowd at the music festival danced wildly to the beat.
meanings.sent5: The raucous dogs barking in the distance added to the chaotic atmosphere of the neighborhood.
